Key Match Events: Mohammad Amir took two wickets in his first two overs upon return.
Pre-Game Insights: Amir had retired from international cricket in 2020, citing mental torture from the Pakistan Cricket Board.
Amir announced his decision to come out of retirement in March 2024, making himself available for the upcoming ICC T20 World Cup 2024 in June.
The move is said to have been spurred by positive discussions with the PCB, with the board reassuring him of his value to the team and the country.
Post-Match Reflections: Amir had told the media ahead of the New Zealand series, 'I am making a comeback for Pakistan after almost four years, this is a very special moment for me. This is like my debut series.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Amir had retired from the international scene in 2020, citing mental torture from the Pakistan Cricket Board.

His career had seemed full of possibilities in his early days, but slammed into a major hurdle in 2010 when he was implicated in a spot-fixing scandal, that led to a five-year ban from all forms of cricket and a brief jail term as well.
Amir overcame the setbacks and made his first comeback to international cricket in January 2016, again showing his splendid skills.
But things took a turn for the worse in December 2020, when Amir, then aged 28, announced his retirement from international cricket.
